chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason J Lacanne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
***TO BE COLLECTED WHILE ON SUPERVISION***
If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay fine of $3,000 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   Pay prosecution costs of $140.00.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

supervisions.notes: ***AJOC - FINE AND COSTS ARE TO BE PAID DURING EXTENDED SUPERVISION***

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carl Johnson.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Count 1 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Count 2 - Dismissed and Read In.  Atty Johnson requests PSI be waived and Atty Trigg does not object.  PSI is waived on DE's motion and sentencing arguments are made.  DE is sentenced to 8 years in the WSP forthwith concurrent to his other sentence; 3 years Initial Confinement followed by 5 years Extended Supervision.  Credit for 148 days.  DE is eligible for CIP & SAP.  Fined $3000 plus costs & surcharges to be paid during extended supervision.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  DE's driving privileges are revoked for 3 years.  AODA Assessment & Ignition Interlock ordered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Attorney Carl Bradford Johnson appeared on behalf of Defendant who does not appear.  Clerk: PT
DE was moved to Dodge Correctional and no writ has been prepared.  FPT adj. to 8/14/15 at 8:40 AM.
Final pre-trial on June 18, 2015 at 02:15 pm confirmed with Atty Johnson and DA's Office to prepare a writ.
Due to a continued jury trial; FPT to be rescheduled with notice to parties.

ADDRESS INFO for Jason J Lacanne
Current: PO Box 661, Dodge Correctional Institution, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 05-26-2015)
Prior: 803 English St, Racine, WI 53402

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Carl Johnson. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 5-27-15 @ 8:50am. Bond continued.

1:30  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Val Karls. Clerk LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on  4-2-15 @ 9:30 am.  $5000 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  If released, Report to WCS by 11:00 the next business day; Submit to random UA's upon request.  Comply w/ all program requirements & provide all required information.
